intro: Centaurea comata, commonly known as the silky centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and distinctive blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has feathery, silver-green foliage that adds visual interest to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Centaurea comata is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
